title: Computer science meets the classroom
notes:
Computer Science Meets the Classroom
Presentation @ https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1i0tcXbGDcOJ3c6FozHrsYuTlEQPAObzRyjZjQdkwtjM/edit?usp=sharing

Facilitators: 
	* Kim Wilkens, St. Anne's-Belfield School, more @ http://techkim.wikispaces.com (@kimxtom)
	* Zach Minster, St. Anne's-Belfield School (@heroiczach)
	* Ann Marie Carrothers, Hive Chicago Learning Network

What's working in CS education?
	* Work experience programs
	* Engaging when framed in real world problems
	* Hands-on engineering
	* Solving problems
	* Getting kids making
	* Interlinking with other subjects, hobbies & their interests
	* CS Unplugged
	* Raspberry Pi
	* Scratch
	* Arduino
	* Coding Clubs
	* Lego Mindstorms

What's not working in CS education?
	* Support within school, computing teachers are low on pecking order
	* No timetable scheduled for computing
	* Disconnect from how it is applied
	* Killing enthusiasm by a curriculum that asks them to write about code
	* Contrived/useless projects
	* Too much focus on math & science
	* Not integrated - "simple experience"
	* Engaging teachers who are scared (those who aren’t already engaged)
	* Lack of interest/access/dollars for disadvantaged/rural communities
	* If not mandatory barrier is too high, people think math and give up before they even try
	* Is not contextualized
	* Ill-defined subject
	* Bogged down by syntax
	* Outdated content
	* Lack of teacher experience
	* Lack of equipment

Where are the gaps in CS education?
	* More Art
	* Need balance between Teaching for mechanics (under the hood) and Teaching for drivers (behind the wheel)
	* No black boxes, no magic
	* Larger & longer term group projects
	* Don’t just need scientists, we need engineers, thinkers, creators

CS Resources shared during session & at MozFest:
	* Hummingbird Robotics Kit @ http://www.hummingbirdkit.com/
	* GROK Learning @ https://groklearning.com/
	* Do It Kits @ http://doitkits.com/
	* OhBot @ http://www.ohbot.co.uk/?lang=en
	* Nature, in Code @ http://www.natureincode.com/
